name: NPR
text:
A North Carolina aquarium has drained a 30-foot waterfall and collected 100 gallons of pocket change visitors have thrown into the water while making wishes.
https://t.co/Z5I0Yi8rex

name: NPR
text: The Secret Service says a "male subject and a USSS officer were both transported to a local hospital." https://t.co/Mnb4VFKIpG

name: NPR
text: The Department of Homeland Security watchdog has criticized Border Patrol for not looking for a cheaper alternative to the border wall, such as cutting-edge surveillance technology.  https://t.co/B9zWhPBa8W

name: NPR
text:
While trying to track those with the coronavirus, contact tracers are running into challenges getting people to cooperate.

In Harris County, Texas, about 25% of people are "absolutely unwilling to share anything," says a health official. https://t.co/vAyUjda2YX

name: NPR
text:
Most people get mild symptoms from the new coronavirus. For others, it can be a long, brutal illness, even if they never land in the hospital. 

Two women detail their continued struggle to recover, more than a hundred days from their first symptoms. 
https://t.co/VfCdc5hcFc

name: NPR
text: More than 20 million people worldwide have tested positive for the coronavirus as of Monday evening ‚Äî nearly five months to the day after the World Health Organization declared it a pandemic. https://t.co/WdXCYUSmh1

name: NPR
text:
The president of Belarus, five-term incumbent Alexander Lukashenko, claimed a landslide victory in elections ‚Äî prompting a long night of violent demonstrations. 

Opposition candidate Svetlana Tikhanovskaya is rejecting the results. https://t.co/WvHADYPB1Z

name: NPR
text:
The Secret Service says a man told a uniformed officer that he had a gun and aimed an object toward the officer, who fired his weapon.

The man was treated at the scene for life-threatening injuries and taken to a hospital, according to a D.C. official. https://t.co/FyWmZeNejJ

name: NPR
text: A California judge has ordered Uber and Lyft to reclassify their drivers from independent contractors to employees with benefits, a ruling that could be consequential for gig economy workers. https://t.co/AZSX6mrDfP

name: NPR
text: 9 people tested positive for the coronavirus after the first week of in-person instruction at a Georgia high school that drew national attention over images of its crowded hallways. https://t.co/wH3xcRncDN

name: NPR
text: Think biking might be for you? This is a great opportunity to try it. Biking gets you out of your home, and regular exercise is good for your mental and physical health -- and you don't need fancy gear or a lycra-ready body to get started. https://t.co/g02bVRSVm9

name: NPR
text:
Every now and again, a young jazz musician turns up out of nowhere to take the whole scene by surprise, and then by storm. 

That's exactly what we're seeing right now from Micah Thomas. https://t.co/IRyKbCqJ6d

name: NPR
text:
Undaunted by the pandemic, voters in Puerto Rico headed out on Sunday to cast votes in a closely watched primary.

But many voting centers did not have ballots, causing chaos ‚Äî and creating an unprecedented legal conundrum. https://t.co/EexD2w8eIf

name: NPR
text: Pushing for herd immunity to end the pandemic has become a really popular idea in some circles, but scientists say that would come with many, many deaths: "We're certainly talking north of a million, probably much more."  https://t.co/XtuUsrZDLL

name: NPR
text:
McDonald's CEO was pushed out in 2019 with a $40 million golden parachute. The golden arches is suing to get it back, saying says he had sexual relationships with at least three employees in the year before he was fired, and gave one a big chunk of stock.
https://t.co/BaAnBVpEPU

name: NPR
text:
New Zealand has now gone 101 days without any local transmission of the coronavirus ‚Äî and life has largely returned to normal.

How has the country been so successful? Experts point to its quick work in isolating any cases that emerged.
https://t.co/iXMPfgZO9S

name: NPR
text:
‚ÄúHarry's journey to wokeness has been very public,‚Äù says Omid Scobie, longtime royal beat reporter and co-author of a sympathetic new book on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.
https://t.co/436X9DhZ6t

name: NPR
text:
With "The Old Guard," Gina Prince-Bythewood is the first Black woman to direct a comic book adaptation. 

"What I bring as a Black female to my craft [is] recognizing how important it is that everybody deserves to be seen as a hero."
https://t.co/GzIGfoiiL4

name: NPR
text:
Most people get mild symptoms from the new coronavirus. For others, it can be a long, brutal illness, even if they never land in the hospital. 

Two women detail their continued struggle to recover, more than a hundred days from their first symptoms.
https://t.co/rjRWdlgsPp

name: NPR
text:
If you aren't in touch with @MosesSumney's music in these times, you're doing yourself a great injustice. Much of his latest album foreshadowed current events.

Watch his Tiny Desk concert recorded at his home in North Carolina üëá https://t.co/pYj6mYezly

name: NPR
text:
A massive effort in China is bulldozing and consolidating tens of thousands of rural villages across the country. 

"The government does not care whether you live or die. They only care about whether you sign an agreement to let them demolish your home."  https://t.co/zsbSGQsUU9

name: NPR
text: A lot of people find community in making music together, but researchers find it can be "a recipe for disaster" in this pandemic: Singers, as well as certain wind and brass instrumentalists, spew a lot of germs into the air. https://t.co/Lj3SDCNage

name: NPR
text: In "Caste," Pulitzer-winning journalist Isabel Wilkerson explores what she names the three resonant caste systems in history: India's caste system, the systemic oppression of Black Americans, and the Nazi caste system ‚Äî which was built on the U.S. model. https://t.co/gm43rPsgBm

name: NPR
text: President Trump falsely claiming in an interview last week that "children are almost, I would almost say definitely, but almost immune from this disease." Child cases surged by 97,000, a jump of 40% in the last two weeks of July. https://t.co/NGJddAxjhJ

name: NPR
text: The hospitalization rate for children does remain low, at 2% -- or nearly 7,000 hospitalizations for severe COVID-1‚Ä¶ https://t.co/s4SxSEAp28

name: NPR
text: Connecticut, Georgia, Minnesota, Vermont and Wisconsin hold primaries today. Rep. Ilhan Omar faces a tough challenge in her Minnesota district, and in Georgia, GOP leaders try to stop a controversial House candidate from becoming the nominee. https://t.co/niR8i9LVcD

name: NPR
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin says Russia is the first country to register a coronavirus vaccine, but experts wa‚Ä¶ https://t.co/CovbzB8xgg

name: NPR
text:
Most laboratory biology is done on just a few organisms -- ones that reproduce fast, are easy to care for, and most importantly, have genes that are easy to manipulate. 

This year, scientists expanded their toolbox with a new model species: squids. https://t.co/rObkeBfMkI

name: NPR
text:
.@Howibuiltthis' @guyraz is live with @iamsambee.

Previously on the Daily Show and now on @FullFrontalSamB, she offers a unique take on the news and explores stories that get overlooked.

What's on her mind these days? Starting at 12pm ET. https://t.co/d3klQaz4Kr

name: NPR
text: Crowds have returned to national parks around the U.S. In recent weeks, the number of cars entering Yellowstone has exceeded last year's count for the same period. The swell in tourists is both a welcome relief and a worry for towns near the parks. https://t.co/VQOFP3oDR3

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRItsBeenAMin: Netflix might be your best friend in this pandemic, but how'd it get so successful? In this episode, @samsanders talks to Peter Kafka and Rani Molla, co-hosts of the podcast ‚ÄúLand of the Giants‚Äù about the rise of the streaming giant.

LISTEN NOW üîä https://t.co/01lKBdRPHT

name: NPR
text: Carmen Best, Seatte's first Black police chief, announced her resignation after the City Council decided to cut the department's funds without her input. Best was criticized for the police's response to recent protests but had kept the mayor's support. https://t.co/3Gvfj5Nw8t

name: NPR
text:
RT @hansilowang: NEW: I spoke with 13 current & former employees at the Census Bureau's local #2020Census offices. With the shortened schedule piled on top of the pandemic & tech problems, many are worried there's not enough time to complete the count safely & accurately:
https://t.co/wLFpue8X6t

name: NPR
text: If you're tired of binge-watching TV during the pandemic, Mother Nature has an alternative tonight: The annual Perseid meteor shower, with 50 to 100 meteors to catch per hour before the moon rises around midnight. https://t.co/0tN8dFqdHn

name: NPR
text:
Russia's new COVID-19 vaccine, dubbed Sputnik-V, has been met with initial skepticism, as it has yet to complete Phase III trials to assess safety and effectiveness in the general population.
https://t.co/4VOSC9v01S

name: NPR
text: The Big Ten Conference is postponing its college football season and other fall sports as coronavirus cases continue to rise. Other Power Five conferences could follow suit. https://t.co/WvGVNkTKXs
